results.title: 20,000 leagues under the sea [study extract]
results.brief_description: From the book by Jules Verne. A breathtaking adventure aboard the “Nautilus”, the nuclear-powered submarine controlled by evil genius Captain Nemo. The cast includes James Mason, Kirk Douglas and Peter Lorne. The film prompts discussion about nuclear energy.

results.title: 20,000 leagues under the sea
results.brief_description: Walt Disney’s entertaining epic version of Jules Verne’s nautical tale, stars James Mason as the evil, renegade Mastermind, Captain Nemo who pilots the fantastic submarine Nautilus on a memorable, adventure-filled journey beneath the seven seas.

results.title: 20 years of African cinema = Camera d'Afrique: the young Arab cinema = Camera Arabe
results.brief_description: Shot on a low budget, ‘Camera d’Afrique’ chronicles 20 years of African, predominantly Francophone West African, cinema. The earliest film, ‘Borom Sarret’ (Ousmane Sembene) is from 1963, and ‘Finye’ (Souleymane Cisse), the most recent title from 1983. The documentary also covers the importance of Film Festivals in Tunis and Ouagadougou to African cinema, the debates of the Panafrican Film-Makers’ Federation (Fepaci), as well as the emergence of directors in the 1980’s. ‘Camera Arabe’, Boughedir’s second major documentary looks at the new Arab cinema of the post-colonial era, an era which owes its greatest debt to Egyptian director, Youssef Chahine. New Arab cinema must contend with Government influence and find itself an audience in an industry that is saturated with imported material. Boughedir interviews film-makers from North Africa as well as the wider Arab world and provides clips from a number of clips from key Arab films. On a critical level, ‘Camera Arabe’ investigates notions of memory, the role of women in Arab culture and the problematic identity of the Arab male.

results.title: 20 Things to make and do = 20 fun things to make and do
results.creator_credit: Science Craft, NWS Channel 9 (Adelaide, S. Aust.), James Lingwood, John Harry, Graham Peach, Ian Richardson and Rob Sheerlock
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Deane and Rob’s Curiosity Show collection”.
Deane Hutton and Rob Morrison from “The Curiosity Show” present twenty of their favourite activities. By following the step-by-step instructions viewers can make twenty different toys and games, using materials readily available around the house.

results.brief_description:
A couple running a grocery store is found murdered. The prime suspect is their own son, Jean-Michel, a brilliant student. When Elizabeth Massot meets the young man, she becomes intrigued by the relationship he had with his parents and starts drawing parallels between Jean-Michel’s situation and her own volatile relationship with son Guillaume.

Credits: Producer, Jean Gauthier ; director, Claude Chabrol ; writers, Claude Chabrol, Odile Barsky ; photography, Jean Rabier ; music, Pierre Jansen, Vladimir Cosma.
Cast: Simone Signoret, Didier Haudepin, Jean-Claude Dauphin, Michel Vitold, Bernadette Lafont, Mario David, Benoit Ferreux.

results.title: 2 x 50 Years of French cinema: night of the filmmakers: I am curious, film
results.creator_credit: BFI, Channel Four, Robert Busch, Lennart Dunner, Anne-Marie Mieville, Jean-Luc Godard, Edgar Reitz and Stig Bjorkman
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Century of cinema”.
2x50 years of French cinema (52 mins, 1995) ‘Why celebrate cinema? Isn’t it famous already?’: Jean-Luc Godard confronts actor Michel Piccoli, president of France’s First Century of Cinema Association with his theory that French cinema has been forgotten, that he and Mieville are making a film about a century of French cinema that will be a chronicle of forgetting. Piccoli puts this theory to the test with the staff of the hotel where he is staying and is dismayed to find barely any recognition of names from French film history or even classic movies such as ‘La regle du jeu’. Set in Munich, in a magnificent new Kinemathek opened to celebrate the first century of cinema, ‘Night of the Filmmakers’ (54 mins, 1994) imagines an assembly of German filmmakers such that only the artifice of film could bring together, attempting to find answers to questions such as, what exactly makes a German film German? How much was lost to German cinema with all the talent fleeing the Nazi regime? What was the effect on film-making on the Berlin Wall? Includes interviews with Volker Schlondorff, Helma Sanders-Brahms, Werner Herzog, Wim Wenders, Frank Beyer and Wolfgang Kohlhasse. Actress Hanna Schygulla reminisces about Rainer Werner Fassbinder. In ‘I am curious, film’ (52 mins, 1995) actress Lena Nyman is Bjoerkman’s guide on a journey through Nordic cinema history, attempting to discover the special elements of Swedish, Danish, Norwegian, Finnish and Icelandic cinema. Her journey is richly illustrated with film clips and includes conversations with filmmakers such as Lars von Trier, Stefan Jarl, Liv Ullman and Aki Kaurismaki. In French, German, Danish with English subtitles - some sections in English.
results.title_for_label: 2 x 50 Years of French cinema: night of the filmmakers: I am curious, film

results.title: 2 Seconds = 2 secondes
results.creator_credit: Max Films, Studiofilms, Roger Frappier and Manon Briand
results.brief_description: Laurie (Charlotte Laurier) is a champion mountain bike racer whose career on the professional circuit comes to an abrupt end after hesitating for two seconds at the start of a race. Forced into retirement at 28, she moves to Montreal where she finds work as a bike courier. Her speed and passion for cycling impresses and threatens her colleagues as she weaves her way through traffic from one job to another. On one of her trips, a broken chain leads her to a bike store tucked away in a quiet street. There she meets the gruff Italian owner Lorenzo (Dino Tavarone), who was a cycling champion in his youth. Initially dismissive and suspicious of Laurie and her obsession with cycling, he slowly begins to trust her, recounting stories from his past on subsequent visits. Although Laurie and Lorenzo appear to move in different worlds, separated by age and gender, they gradually discover that essentially they have much in common, including their taste in women. Cast also includes Pascal Auclair, Yves Pelletier, Andre Brassard, Jici Lauzon and Louise Forestier. Photographed by James Gray; edited by Richard Comeau; music by Sylvain-Charles Grand and Dominique Grand. In French and English with English subtitles.

results.title: 2 ou 3 choses que je sais d'elle = 2 or 3 things I know about her
results.creator_credit: Anouchka Films, Argos Films, Le Films du Carosse, Parc Film and Jean-Luc Godard
results.brief_description: Godard’s controversial reputation as one of the revolutionaries of film art is due to his use of film and video as mediums of philosophical investigation. This film is an essay which explores the relationships between the Western world and the developing world; the Parisian working class and the Gaulist government; US cultural imperialism and the Vietnam War; and the politics that occur when a male director explores the meaning of “woman”. If all this sounds obscure, difficult and pretentious, it is, but it is also exciting, challenging and powerful. At one point in the film a narrator imagines a synthesis of poetry and painting. “2 or 3 Things I know about her” achieves this synthesis in some of the most dazzling scenes ever filmed. What is this film? Literature or sociology? Documentary or essay? A poem or a lecture? Whatever it is, it is one of the most unique and audacious works in the history of cinema. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: 2 artists Queensland: Daphne Mayo and Vida Lahey: a brief look at their lives and works
results.brief_description: Explores the lives and work of sculptor Daphne Mayo, who is remembered for carving large monuments in situ, and Vida Lahey who achieved national eminence as a painter.

results.title: 2 A.M. Feeding
results.brief_description: A realistic look at parenting during the first few months after birth. Touches on a wide range of parental concerns such as nursing, crying and colic, fatigue, mother’s recovery, sexuality, fathering, single parenthood, and returning to work. The program is straightforward, presenting a diverse group of new parents who relate their experiences with warmth and humour.
